Setting.Name: AccountManagement
Setting.Description: Configure a HoloLens device for account management scenarios.

Setting.Name: UserProfilePolicies
Setting.Description: Set options for profile lifetime mangement for shared or communal device scenarios.

Setting.Name: DeletionPolicy
Setting.Description: Configures when profiles will be deleted.

Setting.Name: EnableProfileManager
Setting.Description: Enable profile lifetime mangement for shared or communal device scenarios.

Setting.Name: ProfileInactivityThreshold
Setting.Description: Start deleting profiles when they have not been logged on during the specified period, given as number of days.

Setting.Name: StorageCapacityStartDeletion
Setting.Description: Start deleting profiles when available storage capacity falls below this threshold, given as percent of total storage available for profiles. Profiles that have been inactive the longest will be deleted first.

Setting.Name: StorageCapacityStopDeletion
Setting.Description: Stop deleting profiles when available storage capacity is brought up to this threshold, given as percent of total storage available for profiles.

Setting.Name: Azure
Setting.Description: Bulk Enroll devices in Azure Active Directory.

Setting.Name: Authority
Setting.Description: The authority for the BPRT

Setting.Name: BPRT
Setting.Description: The bulk token for the linked account.

Setting.Name: Users
Setting.Description: Add local users to the computer.

Setting.Name: AssignedAccess
Setting.Description: Configure Assigned Access

Setting.Name: AssignedAccessSettings
Setting.Description: Set account and app (by AUMID). Example: {"Account":"username", "AUMID":"Microsoft.WindowsCalculator_8wekyb3d8bbwe!App"}.

Setting.Name: MultiAppAssignedAccessSettings
Setting.Description: Deploy Multi App Assigned Access configuration xml file to the device

Setting.Name: CACertificates
Setting.Description: Configure intermediate CA certificates on target device

Setting.Name: ClientCertificates
Setting.Description: Configure client certificates on target device

Setting.Name: RootCertificates
Setting.Description: Configure root certificates on target device

Setting.Name: TrustedPeopleCertificates
Setting.Description: Configure certificates into trusted people store on target device

Setting.Name: TrustedProvisioners
Setting.Description: CA certificates used for provisioning package trust.

Setting.Name: PPPProtocolType
Setting.Description: Alwasys set VPN PPPProtocolType to 0x21 (33)

Setting.Name: ProtocolType
Setting.Description: Always set VPN ProtocolType to 0x800 (2048)

Setting.Name: TunnelMTU
Setting.Description: Default value of TunnelMTU is 1400, the allowed range is 1 to 1500.

Setting.Name: Profiles
Setting.Description: Add WLAN profiles to configure wireless connectivity on the target device.

Setting.Name: EnableDeveloperMode
Setting.Description: When set to TRUE, places the device in developer mode

Setting.Name: AuthenticationMode
Setting.Description: Specify how to authentication against the Windows Device Portal

Setting.Name: AuthenticationPassword
Setting.Description: Specifies the password to use when authenticating with the Windows Device Portal

Setting.Name: AuthenticationUserName
Setting.Description: Specifies the user name to use when authenticating with the Windows Device Portal

Setting.Name: UpgradeEditionWithLicense
Setting.Description: Enable an edition upgrade of Windows 10 devices. Does not require reboot.

Setting.Name: PreferredRegion
Setting.Description: Defines the Geo ID of a region that should be configured by the HoloLens First Experience

Setting.Name: PreferredTimezone
Setting.Description: Defines a preselected timezone that should be configured by the HoloLens First Experience

Setting.Name: SkipCalibration
Setting.Description: When set to TRUE, hides the calibration section in the HoloLens First Experience

Setting.Name: SkipTraining
Setting.Description: When set to TRUE, hides the Gesture, Gaze and Voice training sections in the HoloLens First Experience

Setting.Name: SkipWifi
Setting.Description: When set to TRUE, hides the Wi-Fi section in the HoloLens First Experience

Setting.Name: AllowPromptedProximalConnections
Setting.Description: This policy lets you decide whether to allow Windows to prompt users when certain Bluetooth devices are connectable and in range of the user's device.

Setting.Name: AllowPopups
Setting.Description: This setting lets you decide whether to turn on Pop-up Blocker and whether to allow pop-ups to appear in secondary windows.

Setting.Name: DevicePasswordExpiration
Setting.Description: An integer value specifying the number of days before password expiration.

Setting.Name: DevicePasswordHistory
Setting.Description: An integer value specifying the number of passwords stored in history that can't be reused.

Setting.Name: MaxDevicePasswordFailedAttempts
Setting.Description: An integer value that specifies the number of authentication failures allowed before the device will be wiped.

Setting.Name: MinDevicePasswordComplexCharacters
Setting.Description: An integer value that specifies the number of complex element types (uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation) required for a strong password.

Setting.Name: MinDevicePasswordLength
Setting.Description: An integer value that specifies the minimum number of characters required in the PIN.

Setting.Name: AllowTelemetry
Setting.Description: This policy setting determines the amount of diagnostic data reported to Microsoft. A value of 0 indicates that no telemetry data from OS components is sent to Microsoft. Setting a value of 0 is applicable to enterprise and server devices only. Setting a value of 0 for other devices is equivalent to choosing a value of 1. A value of 1 sends only a limited, or basic, amount of diagnostic data. Note that setting values of 0 or 1 will degrade certain experiences on the device. A value of 2 sends enhanced diagnostic data. A value of 3 sends the same data as a value of 2, plus additional diagnostics data, such as the system state at the time of a hang or crash, and the files and content that may have caused the problem. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, users can configure the Telemetry level in Settings.

Setting.Name: BranchReadinessLevel
Setting.Description: Set which branch to receive updates from.

Setting.Name: DeferUpdatePeriod
Setting.Description: Defers Quality Updates for the specified number of weeks.

Setting.Name: DeferUpgradePeriod
Setting.Description: Defers Feature Updates for the specified number of months.

Setting.Name: DetectionFrequency
Setting.Description: Specify the Automatic Updates detection frequency.

Setting.Name: ManagePreviewBuilds
Setting.Description: Set the behavior for receiving preview builds.

Setting.Name: ScheduledInstallEveryWeek
Setting.Description: Every week of the month for installs to take place.

Setting.Name: ScheduledInstallFirstWeek
Setting.Description: First week of the month for installs to take place.

Setting.Name: ScheduledInstallFourthWeek
Setting.Description: Fourth week of the month for installs to take place.

Setting.Name: ScheduledInstallSecondWeek
Setting.Description: Second week of the month for installs to take place.

Setting.Name: ScheduledInstallThirdWeek
Setting.Description: Third week of the month for installs to take place.

Setting.Name: ScheduledInstallTime
Setting.Description: Hour of the day for installs to take place, 0 is midnight.

Setting.Name: UniversalAppInstall
Setting.Description: Install Universal Applications from the Store or Hosted location
